conclusion: To find the magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground, consider the forces acting on the sled and the child.
The weight of the child is calculated using the formula W_child = m_child * g.
The weight of the child is 300 N.
The weight of the sled is calculated using the formula W_sled = m_sled * g.
The weight of the sled is 100 N.
The pulling force exerted by the adult is 100 N at an angle of 37 degrees above the horizontal.
Resolve the pulling force into its components using trigonometric functions.
The horizontal component of the pulling force is 80 N.
The vertical component of the pulling force is 60 N.
Calculate the total vertical force acting on the sled by considering the weights and the vertical component of the pulling force.
The total weight of the child and sled is 400 N.
The effective weight on the ground is reduced by the vertical component of the pulling force, resulting in 340 N.
Determine the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground using the formula P = F_effective / A.
Since the area A is not provided, the magnitude of the force exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
